title: Glanageenty Loop Walk Route
description: This circular walk explores the beautiful Glanageenty Forest in Kerry. You'll follow the waymarked Lenihan's Loop and the Bernard Brothers Loop through the lovely Glanageenty valley. On the way there are pretty streams, peaceful woodland trails, a waterfall and lots of birdlife to see. Keep your eyes peeled for hen harriers, kestrels and pheasants as you make your way along the paths. The woods also have a fascinating history having been used for refuge during the Desmond Rebellion and the Irish Civil War.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Nearby there's the historic town of Castleisland where you can pick up the Castleisland River Walk and enjoy an easy stroll along the River Maine.
